Author: pascalist#3188
Content: Hi, dev!

Author: pascalist#3188
Content:
All coins with transparent address are received in a wallet!
Please tell me - How to receive the coins which are on private the address?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> <pascalist> are you asking about funds in Sprout zaddrs and how to claim? Those funds were not airdropped, but if you can prove you have those funds, we have set aside funds to re-imburse Sprout people

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It would be nice if you could prove it via a viewing key, but those only show funds going in, not coming out of a zaddr. So basically the only way to prove is by providing the private key(s) of addresses with Sprout funds to the Hush Team, we verify balances on old Hush chain and then send the appropriate amount on the HUSH v3 chain to a provided address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The above should sound scary, because it is scary. You should never give your private keys to *anybody*! In this instance, the keys have no financial value and it's the only easy way to prove you had the funds, so by disclosing keys with no financial value, you get funds worth stuff. It would be cool if there was a way to "sign" a message with zaddrs, like taddrs can do (I reported this as a bug to zcash many moons ago) but evidently that is not easy to do and so the above imperfect method is what we have.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Mr_Billion just about every coin has a wallet called CoinWallet and the idea of calling it HushWallet sounded too boring. radix42 actually came up with the name, and I liked it and kept it. Naming things is hard

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Mr_Billion> Naming things is hard, I agree.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Additionally, Pirate (ARRR) is doing the exact same process above. I sent them my private keys via a shielded memo, which is better than email or Discord/Signal/Telegram/Whatsapp. It makes sure that as few people will have access to that data as possible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dandy_sandy> i try ti close the ./hush-cli stop ___
error: incorrect rpcuser or rpcpassword (authorization failed)
is there any way to close instead of kill {id}
changed the conf without closing the daemon and did not make a copy of the old .conf

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @dandy_sandy if you don't have the old user/pass, I am not sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I have CTRL-C'ed/kill'ed many a full node

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> usually it is fine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> rarely it might cause you to reindex when you startup

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dandy_sandy> @dukeleto  yes thats the way i wanted to take if there is no other_ thx

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If you don't know the correct user/pass, your full node will not listen to your RPC commands

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @dandy_sandy i have accidentally done this before too, it happens

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It would not be good if you had a very busy wallet, like an exchange, and you `kill` it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But you have a wallet doing nothing, I imagine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's not receiving/sending 50 payments a minute/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @dandy_sandy try a `kill -15` instead of `kill -9`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that asks the process to gracefully seppuku, instead of forcibly killing it, basically

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dandy_sandy> yes there will be no big trouble _ 
i have also the komodod running and do not find the hushd in the ps -ax
you think this one is the one to kill:
./komodod -ac_name=HUSH3 -ac_sapling=1.....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @dandy_sandy yes, that is it. `hushd` is a wrapper for that command

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @dandy_sandy if you `cat ./src/hushd` you will see all that stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `hushd` is a bash script around our own custom `komodod`
